citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid relatedness between serogroups and serovars in the family Leptospiroceae with proposals for seven new Leptospira species.

p.s: Description of Leptospira wolbachii sp. nov.
Leptospira wolbachii (wol. bach' i. i. N.L. gen. n. wolbachii to honor S . B. Wolbach, the American microbiologist who first identified Leptospira [Spirochaeta] biflexa)
Leptospira wolbachii does not grow at either 11 or 37°C.
Growth occurs in the presence of either 8-azaguanine (225 μg/ml) or 2,6-diaminopurine (10 μg/ml).
Growth is inhibited by copper sulfate (100 ppm).
It contains a serovar from serogroup Codice.
The type strain, strain CDC (= ATCC 43284), is a member of serogroup Codice and serovar codice and was isolated from water in the United States by M.
Ward (19); it has a G+C content of 37.2 ± 0.5 mol%.
